intro: Ptilotrichum purpureum, commonly known as the purple ptilotrichum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a hairy surface that gives it its scientific name. The flowers are arranged in spikes and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
